title: Top 10 trending phones of week 13
description: Samsung Galaxy A56 completed its March clean sweep, extending its streak at the top of our trending chart to four weeks. The Poco F7 Ultra capitalized on its official announcement to mount a serious challenge, but ultimately ended up with the silver medal. [#InlinePriceWidget, 13603, 1#] The Infinix Note 50 Pro+ added another podium to its tally, taking third this time around, while the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra retained its fourth position. The other member of Poco's new duo, the F7 Pro came fifth, just ahead of its X7 Pro stablemate. We then have the Samsung Galaxy A36 and the...
excerpt: The Poco F7 Ultra came close, but ultimately the Galaxy A56 scored another win. Samsung Galaxy A56 completed its March clean sweep, extending its streak at...
text: Samsung Galaxy A56 completed its March clean sweep, extending its streak at the top of our trending chart to four weeks. The Poco F7 Ultra capitalized on its official announcement to mount a serious challenge, but ultimately ended up with the silver medal. Samsung Galaxy A56 These are the best offers from our affiliate partners. We may get a commission from qualifying sales. 128GB 8GB RAM$ 419.50€ 479.00256GB 12GB RAM$ 429.97C$ 687.07Show all prices The Infinix Note 50 Pro+ added another podium to its tally, taking third this time around, while the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra retained its fourth position. The other member of Poco's new duo, the F7 Pro came fifth, just ahead of its X7 Pro stablemate. We then have the Samsung Galaxy A36 and the outgoing Galaxy A55, taking seventh and eighth spots, respectively. In ninth we have the vivo X200 Ultra - the beastly camera flagship is not even official yet and odds are it will never be available outside China, but its camera setup is so impressive it still got a bunch of you checking it out. Finally, the Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max returns to the top 10 to complete the week 13 edition of the chart. Notably this means we once again have five different markers represented among the most popular devices in our database, which is an encouraging sign as it points to strong competition in the market.
html:
Samsung Galaxy A56 completed its March clean sweep, extending its streak at the top of our trending chart to four weeks. The Poco F7 Ultra capitalized on its official announcement to mount a serious challenge, but ultimately ended up with the silver medal.

Samsung Galaxy A56

These are the best offers from our affiliate partners. We may get a commission from qualifying sales.
128GB 8GB RAM$ 419.50€ 479.00
256GB 12GB RAM$ 429.97C$ 687.07
Show all prices

The Infinix Note 50 Pro+ added another podium to its tally, taking third this time around, while the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra retained its fourth position.

The other member of Poco's new duo, the F7 Pro came fifth, just ahead of its X7 Pro stablemate.

We then have the Samsung Galaxy A36 and the outgoing Galaxy A55, taking seventh and eighth spots, respectively.

In ninth we have the vivo X200 Ultra - the beastly camera flagship is not even official yet and odds are it will never be available outside China, but its camera setup is so impressive it still got a bunch of you checking it out.

Finally, the Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max returns to the top 10 to complete the week 13 edition of the chart. Notably this means we once again have five different markers represented among the most popular devices in our database, which is an encouraging sign as it points to strong competition in the market.
